I'd give this game a 5/5, I have thoroughly enjoyed my time so far.

I initially downloaded this game to try out during the free Halloween promotion. After playing for a few days, I decided to buy it along with some of the available dlc, as I enjoyed what I saw. After playing this game for a good week, I can say without a doubt that this is one of my favorite games. Surprisingly, I have found myself enjoying both survivor and killer equally. I had expected killer to be the most fun overall, as they seemed to have more variety. However, survivor gameplay is equally as exciting, and It's actually quite fun trying to escape. Overall I'd say this game is very fun, and I'm excited to see what's in store for the future!

The game is hide and seek plus extreme freeze tag ‚Äì except the person tagging you has a machete.

Gameplay is very straight forward and easy to pick up. However, once you start learning the intricacies and mind-games each side has, you realize this game is so much deeper than it appears.

Dead by Daylight is the horror hall of fame. Nearly every mainstream slasher superstar is here. Michael Myers, Leatherface, Freddie Kruger, the list goes on and on. They add a new killer every 3 months and the original killers they create for this game stand up great beside the licensed killers. All the killers have a unique power meaning you‚Äôll always have to play differently depending on which killer you get each game.

Each player gets to choose 4 perks from a pool of nearly 100 (for each side) so the build combinations are nearly endless. Each map is procedurally generated randomizing the position and orientation of tiles, obstacles, chests, and objectives. All these things combine to ensure no two games are the same.
Pros:
‚Ä¢ Great asymmetrical gameplay. Must play if you miss Evolve.
‚Ä¢ Incredibly deep game ‚Äì there‚Äôs always something new to learn/try.
‚Ä¢ 10/10 atmosphere. You‚Äôll feel like you‚Äôre in a horror movie.
‚Ä¢ The licensed killers really feel like their movie counterparts. Reverse beartraps from Saw fit in great here.
‚Ä¢ Developers are constantly updating the game‚Äôs balance and meta. New killers and survivors added every 3 months.
‚Ä¢ Graphics recently received an overhaul for next gen. Maps and characters look much better than on release 5+ years ago.

Cons:
‚Ä¢ Meta has players using the same 10-15 perks (overwhelmingly the strongest ones).
‚Ä¢ Game has a steep learning curve after you get the basics down. Good opponents will initially make you feel completely inept until you start learning.
‚Ä¢ Some gameplay styles can make the game very frustrating (killers camping or tunneling a single survivor).
‚Ä¢ A segment of the community is incredibly toxic ‚Äì turning off postgame chat is highly advised.

TLDR; Spooky game good. Don‚Äôt treat it like competitive CS:GO and you can have thousands of hours of fun here.

PS: Someday well get an Alien DLC Chapter with a Xenomorph killer and Ellen Ripley as a survivor. On that day this game will be complete. (Okay maybe Jason, Candyman, and Chucky too‚Ä¶)

Jogo delicia da at√© vontade de 8===D ============= (-)

I am recommending this game with a few small notes.

- The devs have been on and off again with the quality of content and their patches. Often the game can be basically unplayable, but is usually fixed within a week or two of a game-breaking bug being found.

- The community is dogshit. Play this game with friends. If you want to play killer (like I do), then you need to learn to ignore all of the shit that people will give you. 

- This game takes some skill. You will get destroyed for your first 8ish hours. And depending on your role and the players you are with, you will probably get bullied. 

At the end of the day, however, this game is really fun and is often worth playing.
